page.title: 11EMPLOYMENT AND INDUSTRY
page.content: National trends in the changing face of industry and employment are well reflected in our area which has a relatively high level of unemployment. The importance of textiles and iron in the area has declined, but these have been replaced by many new industries. The chemical industry has a long acquaintance with Wyke, and Allied Colloids and Mark's Chemicals still provide a lot of employment. Just to the east of our block, the large Euroway Industrial Estate has been developed next to the M606. This provides work for many people from Wyke and Low Moor. A Department of Employment Skill Centre runs courses for retraining unemployed people from the Bradford area.
